required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Reslizumab to Treat Poorly Controlled Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: An Efficacy and Safety Study of Reslizumab in the Treatment of Poorly Controlled Asthma in Subjects With Eosinophilic Airway Inflammation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness and safety of reslizumab in the treatment of subjects with poorly controlled asthma.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objectives:
Primary: To demonstrate the ability of reslizumab to improve asthma control in subjects with active asthma and eosinophilic airway inflammation.
Secondary:
- To study the ability of reslizumab to reduce induced sputum eosinophil (EOS) counts in subjects with asthma.
- To study the ability of reslizumab to reduce the number of eosinophilic clinical asthma exacerbations (CAE) in subjects with asthma. A CAE is defined as a ≥ 20% decrease in forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1; absolute value) from the baseline value or a requirement for emergency treatment of asthma, hospital admission for asthma or treatment with three or more days of oral corticosteroids (OCS) for asthma worsening.
- To assess the safety and tolerability of reslizumab in subjects with asthma.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline to End of Therapy in Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: The ACQ is a 7 question instrument. Each question has 7 possible answers of 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. Each increasing value is an indication of poorer asthma control. At protocol specified visits, the participant answered questions 1 to 6, circling the response that best described how that participant was during the past week, on the basis of a daily diary for the week before the visit. At the actual visit, study center personnel reviewed the questions and responses with the participant and determined the response and score for question 7. The overall ACQ score was presented as the mean of these 7 individual scores and was a number between 0 and 6, but not necessarily an integer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of ACQ Responders at End of Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Responders were defined as participants achieving at least a 0.5 reduction from baseline to End of Therapy in ACQ score. The ACQ is a 7 question instrument. Each question has 7 possible answers of 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. Each increasing value is an indication of poorer asthma control. At protocol specified visits, the participant answered questions 1 to 6, circling the response that best described how that participant was during the past week, on the basis of a daily diary for the week before the visit. At the actual visit, study center personnel reviewed the questions and responses with the participant and determined the response and score for question 7. The overall ACQ score was presented as the mean of these 7 individual scores and was a number between 0 and 6, but not necessarily an integer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy in Forced Expiratory Volume in the First Second (FEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The change in FEV1 from baseline to End of Therapy was determined. FEV1 was measured during pulmonary function tests using standard spirometry measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Therapy in Percent Predicted FEV1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The change in percent predicted FEV1 from baseline to End of Therapy was calculated from the FEV1 measured during pulmonary function tests using standard spirometry measurements. Each participant's percent predicted FEV1 was calculated by adjusting the FEV1 for age, sex, height and race. The percent predicted FEV1 was then calculated by comparing the predicted FEV1 to the observed FEV1 using the Crapo formula (Crapo et al 1981a, Crapo and Morris 1981b, Crapo et al 1982).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline to End of Therapy in Induced Sputum Eosinophil Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Screening or Baseline, End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Asthma Exacerbations (CAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: A CAE was defined as a 20% or more decrease in forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1, absolute value) from the baseline value, a requirement for emergency treatment of asthma, hospital admission for asthma, or treatment with 3 or more days of oral corticosteroids for asthma worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs, and AEs Leading to Study Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug through 15 weeks + 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Participants may have been included in more than 1 category. AEs summarized were those that began or worsened after dispensation of the study drug and before 30 days after the last dose of study drug. If the severity of an AE was missing, the AE was reported as "severe." If drug relationship of an AE was missing, the AE was reported as "probably related." WFT=withdrawn from treatment.

arm_group.description: Reslizumab 3 mg/kg intravenous (IV) on Day 0 of each 28-day (+/- 7 days) cycle, for 4 cycles
Saline placebo IV on Day 0 of each 28-day (+/- 7 days) cycle, for 4 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- written informed consent
- male or female subjects aged ≥ 18 to 75 years at time of screening
- female if she is of non-childbearing potential, or of childbearing potential and willing to use specific barrier methods specified in protocol
- confirmation of asthma
- symptoms consistent with a diagnosis of asthma that is poorly controlled with an inhaled corticosteroid as determined by an Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ) score ≥ 1.5
- requirement for treatment with high dose daily fluticasone and at least one other agent for the treatment of asthma not specifically excluded in the protocol
- requirement for >/= 3% eosinophils in induced sputum at Screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- a clinically important event that would interfere with study schedule or procedure or compromise subject safety
- a diagnosis of hypereosinophilic syndrome
- an underlying lung disorder
- a current smoker
- use of systemic immunosuppressive agents within 6 months of study
- current use of systemic corticosteroids
- received attenuated live attenuated vaccines within three months prior to study entry
- expected to be poorly compliant with study drug, procedures, visits
- aggravating factors that are inadequately controlled
- participation in any investigational drug or device study within 30 days prior to study entry
- participation in biologics study within 3 months prior to study entry
- receipt of anti-human interleukin-5 (hIL-5) antibody within 6 months of study entry
- female subjects who are pregnant or nursing
- concurrent infection or disease that may preclude assessment of eosinophilic esophagitis
- concurrent immunodeficiency (human immunodeficiency [HIV], or acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [AIDS] or congenital immunodeficiency).
- current suspected drug and/or alcohol abuse

facility.name: Children'S Hospital of Orange County-Pediatric Subspecialty Faculty
Pulmonary Disease & Critical Care Associates, P.A.
Washington University of School of Medicine
Health Sciences Research at Asthma & Allergy
Allergy, Asthma and Clinical Research Center
Clinical Research Institute of Southern Oregon
Vanderbilt Asthma Sinus Allergy Program & Research Centers
Virginia Adult & Pediatric Allergy and Asthma
University of Wisconsin-Madison, Allergy/Asthma Clinical Research Unit
Heritage Medical Research Clinic, University of Calgary

reference.citation: Castro M, Mathur S, Hargreave F, Boulet LP, Xie F, Young J, Wilkins HJ, Henkel T, Nair P; Res-5-0010 Study Group. Reslizumab for poorly controlled, eosinophilic asthma: a randomized, placebo-controlled study. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2011 Nov 15;184(10):1125-32. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201103-0396OC. Epub 2011 Aug 18.

outcome.description: The ACQ is a 7 question instrument. Each question has 7 possible answers of 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. Each increasing value is an indication of poorer asthma control. At protocol specified visits, the participant answered questions 1 to 6, circling the response that best described how that participant was during the past week, on the basis of a daily diary for the week before the visit. At the actual visit, study center personnel reviewed the questions and responses with the participant and determined the response and score for question 7. The overall ACQ score was presented as the mean of these 7 individual scores and was a number between 0 and 6, but not necessarily an integer.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of Therapy (up to 15 weeks)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) Analysis Set: all participants who received any amount of randomly assigned study drug.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value for the treatment comparison is based on the ANCOVA with adjustment for stratification factor and for variable at baseline.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline to End of Therapy in Induced Sputum Eosinophil Levels
measure.population: ITT Analysis Set: all participants who received any amount of randomly assigned study drug with an assessment at Baseline and End of Therapy.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value for the treatment comparison was based on the ANCOVA with adjustment for stratification factor and for variable at baseline. The difference between reslizumab 3.0 mg/kg and placebo groups was from comparison of the least square means.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Asthma Exacerbations (CAEs)
outcome.description: A CAE was defined as a 20% or more decrease in forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1, absolute value) from the baseline value, a requirement for emergency treatment of asthma, hospital admission for asthma, or treatment with 3 or more days of oral corticosteroids for asthma worsening.
outcome.population: ITT Analysis Set: all participants who received any amount of randomly assigned study drug.

group.title: Reslizumab 3 mg/kg
group.description: reslizumab 3 mg/kg intravenous (IV) on Day 0 of each 28-day (+/- 7 days) cycle, for 4 cycles

group.title: Placebo
group.description: saline placebo IV on Day 0 of each 28-day (+/- 7 days) cycle, for 4 cycles

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Asthma Exacerbations (CAEs)
measure.description: A CAE was defined as a 20% or more decrease in forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1, absolute value) from the baseline value, a requirement for emergency treatment of asthma, hospital admission for asthma, or treatment with 3 or more days of oral corticosteroids for asthma worsening.
measure.population: ITT Analysis Set: all participants who received any amount of randomly assigned study drug.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value for the treatment comparison was based on logistic regression with adjustment for stratification factor.

analysis.groups_desc: Kaplan-Meier estimate of time to first CAE. (First quartile, median and third quartile “survival” times with 95% confidence intervals (ie, time to first CAE) could not be estimated since the proportion of patients experiencing CAE was too low. Therefore, the only number presented in regard to the Kaplan-Meier analysis is the p-value of the log-rank test, below. )
analysis.method_desc: The p value for the treatment comparison was based on log rank test adjusting for stratification factor (ie, ACQ score ≤2 and >2).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs, and AEs Leading to Study Discontinuation
outcome.description: Participants may have been included in more than 1 category. AEs summarized were those that began or worsened after dispensation of the study drug and before 30 days after the last dose of study drug. If the severity of an AE was missing, the AE was reported as “severe.” If drug relationship of an AE was missing, the AE was reported as “probably related.” WFT=withdrawn from treatment.

outcome.population: ITT Analysis Set: all participants who received any amount of randomly assigned study drug with an assessment at Baseline and End of Therapy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor has the right 60 days before submission for publication to review/provide comments. If the Sponsor's review shows that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure shall be delayed for up to 90 additional days in order for the Sponsor, or Sponsor's designees, to file the necessary patent applications. In multicenter trials, each PI will postpone single center publications until after disclosure or publication of multicenter data.

point_of_contact.organization: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.
